subject: Re: [junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
msgSnippet: When writing tests, one verifies expected behavior by writing assertions. Assertions are method calls, (e.g. assertTrue, assertEquals, and many others
messageBody:
When writing tests, one verifies expected behavior by writing assertions.
Assertions are method calls, (e.g. assertTrue, assertEquals, and many others
explained in http://www.junit.org/apidocs/org/junit/Assert.html) that test
against values produced by the test. They throw AssertionFailedError when a
particular condition is not met.

The exception you got shows that the following assertion failed:

assertEquals(
"Message variable contains message",
instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("message"),
"Going to the first state!-auction"
);

There are three arguments to this assertEquals assertion. First, the string
is a message that is printed when the assertion fails. The messages are
usually used to help with debugging by describing what an assertion does in
a human-readable way. The second argument is the expected value and the
third is the actual value. In your example, the arguments are backward. It
is most common for the expected side to be a literal (in this case a String)
and the actual side to be the result of the computation that you want to
test.

assertEquals(
"Message variable contains message",
"Going to the first state!-auction",
instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("message")
);

Back to your error. When assertEqual fails, it shows the string values of
the expected and actual sides to again aid in debugging. Therefore, the
exception you got is telling you that the getVariable method returned null
when it should have instead returned the string "Going to the first
state!-auction". The test has failed and you need to start debugging to find
out why.

Brett

On Fri, Feb 26, 2010 at 6:43 PM, t_kiran <thirumala_kirana@...>wrote:

>
>
>
> I am a Newbie to Junit...i was trying a practice application in JBPM
> part of the code i have wriiten from that tutorial of JBPM is
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------
> ProcessInstance instance = new ProcessInstance(processDefinition);
> assertEquals(
> "Instance is in start state",
> instance.getRootToken().getNode().getName(),
> "start");
> assertNull(
> "Message variable should not exist yet",
> instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("message"));
>
>
> instance.signal();
> assertEquals(
> "Instance is in auction state",
> instance.getRootToken().getNode().getName(),
> "auction");
> assertEquals(
> "Message variable contains message",
> instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("message"),
> "Going to the first state!-auction"
> );
>
>
> instance.signal();
> assertEquals(
> "Instance is in end state",
> instance.getRootToken().getNode().getName(),
> "end1");
> assertTrue("Instance has ended", instance.hasEnded());
> assertEquals(
> "Message variable is changed",
> instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("message"),
> "About to finish!");
> ----------------------------------------------------------
>
> i am getting the following error...
>
> =====
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Message variable contains message
> expected:<null> but was:<Going to the first state!-auction>

> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
